content.content: So I’ve figured that Uniswap has the contract at https://etherscan.io/address/0x1f9840a85d5af5bf1d1762f925bdaddc4201f984 to delegate, view votes etc. But where does Uniswap submit proposals and vote on them? Does it have a Governor Alpha contract similar to Compound? If so, what is the address? If not, where and how is it done? (Fair warning: I only have half a clue what I’m talking about as I’ve never actually had anything to do with the Compound Governor Alpha contract)
content.GPT-summary: The author is asking a question about the Governor Alpha contract of Uniswap and how proposals are submitted and voted on. The author also mentions not having much knowledge about the Compound Governor Alpha contract.

content.content: Governor Alpha contract is here:    Ethereum (ETH) Blockchain Explorer    Contract Address 0x5e4be8Bc9637f0EAA1A755019e06A68ce081D58F | Etherscan The Contract Address 0x5e4be8Bc9637f0EAA1A755019e06A68ce081D58F page allows users to view the source code, transactions, balances, and analytics for the contract address. Users can also interact and make transactions to the contract directly on...
for posterity, a list of all governance-related contracts may be found here: https://uniswap.org/docs/v2/governance/overview/
